intro: Picradenia intermedia, commonly known as the African sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and alternate, simple leaves. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by round, woody fruits containing a single seed. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
